resources.string: umque ibi diu moratur commeatus opperiens, quorum translationem ex Aquitania verni imbres solito crebriores prohibebant auctique torrentes, Herculanus advenit protector domesticus
Welcome to Pimp My Z1, the all-in-one app your Xperia Z1 was yearning for.
Learn everything about every single feature of Pimp My Z1, and become a lvl.99 Android nerd along the way ;)
This tool allows you to set your CPU min/max frequencies, governors, I/O schedulers and a lot more
This tool allows you to control your GPU\'s minimum & maximum frequencies, and overlock it if supported by your kernel.
This section allows you to control various power management features of your kernel (if implemented)
This section contains various kernel-level I/O tweaks, such as your I/O Schedulers settings, dynamic file sync, I/O readahead, etc…
Your kernel does not seem to implement Faux123\'s Sound Control driver, or the version it implements is not supported, sorry :(
Controls the audio volume gain for the headphone digital output
Controls the audio volume gain for the headphone analog output\n(PowerAmp gain)
Controls the audio volume gain for the speaker analog output
Controls the audio volume gain for the microphone input
Controls the audio volume gain for the camera microphone input
Sorry, this section isn\'t available at the moment
When Pen Mode is enabled, you will be able to use any pen or non-plastic object as a stylus on your Sony Xperia Z1 touchscreen.
With Glove Mode enabled, you will be able to use the touchscreen on your Xperia Z1 even while wearing gloves.
This section allows you to tweak your kernel features to your liking, from CPU & GPU overclocking to governors, I/O schedulers, TCP congestion algorithms and much more…
Tweak the volume of your headphones output, speaker, camera mic & sound recording mic if you are using a kernel which implements Faux123\'s Sound Control.
Control your Xperia Z1 touch-screen, from adding support for any pen or non-plastic object to tweaking the smallest parameters like touch pressure, target size, max speed, drag range, etc…

When Dynamic Fsync is enabled, file sync will be delayed until the screen is turned off, at which point all pending write operations are synced, allowing for better performance while using the device.
Your kernel\'s Dynamic Fsync version is: \'

With Multi-Core Power Savings enabled, the CPU will try to use as few cores as possible by using one core until it is maxed-out. This allows to save quite a lot of battery.\nTwo levels of aggressiveness are available.

Intelli_plug is a hotplug driver created by Faux123 as an open-source replacement for Qualcomm\'s closed-source msm_mpdecision driver. As such, it is more customizable and has a different and possibly more optimized strategy.
Intelli_plug\'s eco mode is a hotplug strategy optimized to keep 2 cores offline as often as possible, thus saving a great deal of battery.

Power Suspend is an open-source kernel power management driver created by Faux123, it replaces the now aging early_suspend driver.\nPower Suspend allows for better battery savings while the screen is off.
Your changes will be lost after a reboot
Your changes will be applied after each reboot
Control some miscellaneous kernel features, such as VM parameters, Kernel Same-page Merging and more

Enabling Kernel Same-page Merging reduces memory usage and increases performance by allowing the system to scan for duplicate memory pages, merge them and allow those pages to be shared amongst different processes
Sorry, your kernel does not seem to support KSM.
Amount of pages KSM should scan at each run
Defines the interval of time (in milliseconds) at which KSM will scan for mergeable memory pages
Snake Charmer by faux123 allows to limit the maximum CPU frequency for all cores
Sorry, your kernel does not seem to support Dynamic Fsync.
Defines the I/O Scheduler to use for the internal storage
Defines the I/O Scheduler to use for the external storage/SD-Card
Specifies the amount of data in kilobytes that are read and cached ahead of time by the I/O Scheduler for the internal storage
Specifies the amount of data in kilobytes that are read and cached ahead of time by the I/O Scheduler for the external SD-Card
Flash devices have few randomness and as such they are a very poor source of entropy, disable for better performance.
Enable to control each core\'s governor independently, disable to use the same governor for all cores.
Control the memory management features of your kernel, such as Kernel Same-page Merging, zRam, Swap, VM parameters and more…
Values higher than %1$d are not recommended
Allows to set the device\'s vibrator intensity at kernel level by modifying its voltage
